Any recent Ubuntu version shouldn't give you a hd* but should give you a sd* name.
No.  They could/are both correct.  hd* are PATA drives, sd* are SATA.  Recent Linux versions have merged everything into sd*, and on some hardware IDE comes first, others IDE comes second.
So, under the old style, you have sda and hda, and then under the new one, one of those is sda and the other is sdb.  Obviously in this case, sda -> sda and hda -> sdb
One SATA drive is sdb?  Your first, or second SATA drive?
ok.  And whats the question then?
Yes.  hd* won't appear on newer kernels, they've got a sata emulation layer in there.
Now everything is sd*
Newer kernel, yeah.
